title: Quizzer AI
description: An adaptive learning platform that generates infinite programming quizzes using Google Gemini AI, providing personalized questions, instant feedback, and context-aware explanations for every mistake you make.
longDescription:
Quizzer AI revolutionizes technical interview prep by ditching static question banks. It uses the Gemini Flash Lite engine to generate unique questions on the fly based on user prompts from Python syntax to System Design architecture.

Beyond generation, it acts as a tutor: if you get a question wrong, the system analyzes your specific logic error and explains *why* the answer was incorrect, rather than just showing the right option. Built with Django 5 and HTMX, it features a distraction-free 'Midnight' UI, split-screen code analysis with Prism.js syntax highlighting, and persistent history tracking across sessions.
features: HTMX-powered SPA feel without page reloads
installation:
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/quizzer-ai.git
cd quizzer-ai

# Enter project folder and install dependencies
cd qtrmrs
uv sync

# Run migrations and start server
uv run manage.py migrate
uv run manage.py runserver

title: Algorithm Visualizer
description: An educational platform that visualizes sorting and pathfinding algorithms in real time, streaming execution states frame-by-frame from a FastAPI backend to a React frontend via WebSockets.
longDescription:
Unlike standard visualizers that pre-calculate steps, AlgoVisualizer runs the actual algorithm on the Python backend and streams the state frame-by-frame to the React frontend via WebSockets. This allows for true live execution with VCR-style controls (Play, Pause, Step Forward, Step Backward).

It supports Sorting algorithms (Bubble, Insertion, Selection) with color-coded bars showing comparisons and swaps, and Pathfinding algorithms (Dijkstra, BFS, DFS) with an interactive grid where you can draw walls, move start/end nodes, and watch the algorithm explore. Features include adjustable playback speed (10ms to 1000ms), pseudocode tracking, and an execution log of every operation.
installation:
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/algorithm-visualizer.git
cd algorithm-visualizer

# Install dependencies
cd backend && uv sync && cd ..
cd frontend && npm install && cd ..

# Terminal 1: Backend
cd backend && uv run uvicorn app.main:app --reload

# Terminal 2: Frontend
cd frontend && npm run dev

title: GitNexus
description: A powerful, self-hosted dashboard that bridges the gap between the cloud and your local machine. Discover users, track releases, and time-travel through commit history.
longDescription:
GitNexus is a powerful, self-hosted dashboard that bridges the gap between the cloud and your local machine. It allows you to discover users, track releases, and time-travel through commit history in a unified workspace.

Key features include the 'Discovery Engine' for deep profile analysis, 'Asset Watchtower' for monitoring tool updates, and the new 'Repo Replay' for spinning up isolated dev servers from historical commits. Built with a local-first philosophy, all data stays on your machine using SQLite.

title: Arcade Nexus
description: A browser-based gaming console experience built with React and FastAPI, featuring a custom Game SDK for game development, cloud-synced save states, achievements tracking, and an immersive console-style UI.
longDescription:
Arcade Nexus is a web application designed to emulate the feeling of a gaming console directly in your browser. It features a custom boot sequence, dashboard interface, and a dedicated TypeScript Game SDK for developing games that integrate seamlessly with the platform.

The SDK handles game loops, input management (keyboard/gamepad), and state persistence. Games can leverage cloud-synced save data, a global achievement tracking system, and instant launch from the library. The backend uses FastAPI with SQLite (AioSQLite + SQLAlchemy) for async database operations, JWT authentication, and Pydantic validation. Built-in games include Snake with more in development.

title: Tremors Music
description: A high-performance, local-first music player with both web and native desktop versions featuring a Python backend, React UI with glassmorphism design, and optional Tauri shell for minimal resource usage.
longDescription:
Tremors Music is a unified music player that runs as both a web app and a native desktop application. It combines a Python FastAPI backend for metadata parsing and audio streaming, with a modern React frontend featuring virtualization, synchronized lyrics, and Apple Music-inspired design.

The desktop version uses Tauri (Rust shell) with the Python backend compiled as a sidecar, achieving ~100-200MB RAM usage 70% less than the web version. Handles 10,000+ song libraries with ease.
installation:
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/tremors-music.git
cd tremors-music

# Install Dependencies
cd backend && uv sync && cd ..
cd frontend && npm install && cd ..

# Run Web Version
# Terminal 1: Backend
cd backend && uv run uvicorn main:app --reload
# Terminal 2: Frontend
cd frontend && npm run dev

# Run Desktop Version (Tauri)
cd tauri && npm install && npm run dev

title: Earnslate
description: A personal finance manager built with Next.js 16 and Zustand for tracking income, expenses, budgets, and subscriptions all stored locally in your browser with a premium monochrome interface.
longDescription:
Earnslate is a privacy-first personal finance app that runs entirely in your browser with no backend required. All data persists in localStorage, meaning no account signup and full offline capability.

Features include a real-time dashboard with spending breakdown charts, full transaction CRUD with search/filters/pagination, budget tracking with auto-reset on period expiry, and subscription management with 100+ service templates (Netflix, Spotify, AWS, etc.). The UI is built with CSS Modules (no Tailwind) and custom SVG charts no external chart libraries. Keyboard shortcuts (Ctrl+N, Ctrl+D/T/B) provide power-user navigation.
installation:
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/earnslate.git
cd earnslate/earnslate-app

# Install dependencies and run
npm install
npm run dev

title: E-commerce Platform
description: A minimalist e-commerce platform built with Django 5, featuring product catalogs, shopping cart, wishlist, coupon system, Razorpay payments, and user authentication with email verification and OTP password resets.
longDescription:
A clean, minimalist e-commerce platform built on Django 5 that prioritizes user experience and performance. Features include categorized products with search and filtering, shopping cart with quantity management, wishlist functionality, and a discount coupon system with usage tracking.

The checkout flow integrates with Razorpay payment gateway with signature verification. User functionality includes registration with email verification, secure login, profile management with picture uploads, complete order history with cancellation support, and OTP-based password resets. Built with Bootstrap 5 for a responsive, modern interface.

title: Cosmos
description: A high-performance 3D solar system simulation running in your browser with custom GLSL shaders, realistic orbital mechanics, 6-DOF fly controls, and full gamepad support.
longDescription:
Cosmos is a modular, scientifically-inspired solar system visualizer built with React and Three.js. It features 9 planets (including Pluto), 4 moons, a 2000-asteroid belt, and custom GLSL shaders for each celestial body from procedural sun granulation to atmospheric band dynamics on ice giants.

The control system supports 6 degrees of freedom with keyboard, mouse, and gamepad input. A radar HUD provides directional awareness, and the camera can lock onto any celestial body for orbital viewing. The codebase is fully modular with centralized physics constants in SDK.ts, making it easy to extend with new celestial objects.
features: Custom GLSL Shaders for Each Planet
installation:

cd cosmos/cosmos-app

# Install dependencies and run
npm install
npm run dev

title: Social Network Platform
description: A modern social networking platform featuring public feeds, direct & group messaging, community spaces with channels, and a unified dual-mode navigation â€” built with React 19, Zustand, and Tailwind CSS v4.
longDescription:
SocNet combines public broadcast feeds with server-based community channels into a single unified interface. Users can compose posts, interact through likes, reposts, and replies, send direct or group messages, discover and join communities, explore trending topics, and manage their profiles and settings.

The frontend is built with React 19 and TypeScript, using Vite as the build tool. State management is handled by Zustand, and the UI is styled with Tailwind CSS v4 and Lucide React icons. The app features a dual-mode navigation sidebar that contextually switches between global navigation and community channel views based on the active route. Backend integration is planned for a future release.

Community Spaces with Text & Voice Channels

title: gtrmrs
description: A unified suite of dependency-free, Git-aware CLI tools for developers that combines directory tree visualization, lines of code counting, and clean repository migration into a single powerful utility.
longDescription: gtrmrs is a unified CLI toolkit that combines three previously separate utilities into a single, cohesive application. It integrates 'RepoTree' for visualizing directory structures as ASCII trees, 'Locr' for counting lines of code with gitignore awareness, and 'GitMig' for managing partial repository migrations using sparse-checkout. This unification simplifies installation and provides a central entry point for these common development tasks.
installation:
# Clone and install
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/gtrmrs.git
cd gtrmrs
pip install -e .

# Usage
rtree
locr
gitmig ./backup --dry-run

title: Plant Disease Detector
description: A Django web app using TensorFlow and MobileNetV2 to classify apple leaf diseases from uploaded images, featuring drag-and-drop analysis, confidence charts, and a scan history database.
longDescription:
A Proof of Concept (PoC) demonstrating the integration of TensorFlow into a Django 5 web app. It uses Transfer Learning on a pre-trained MobileNetV2 model (ImageNet weights) to classify apple leaves into four categories: Healthy, Apple Scab, Black Rot, and Cedar Apple Rust.

The app features a drag-and-drop upload interface, real-time confidence scoring with interactive probability charts rendered using Plotly.js, and a persistent SQLite history database of all past scans. The project is managed with uv for fast, reproducible Python environments and includes a training script for model retraining on custom datasets.
installation:
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/plant-disease-detector.git
cd plant-disease-detector

# Install dependencies (using uv)
uv sync

# Run migrations and start server
uv run python manage.py migrate
uv run python manage.py runserver

title: Tremors
description: A multi-mode portfolio website with 5 distinct viewing modes, GitHub integration, AI-generated newspaper content, and secret admin controls built with Next.js 16, React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS 4, and Prisma.
longDescription:
Tremors Portfolio is a personal portfolio website with multiple innovative viewing modes: Default (modern card-based layout), Terminal (interactive CLI with 30+ commands), Paper (document/resume-style with sidebar TOC), Newspaper (editorial magazine-style with AI-generated content), and Nexus (interactive space environment with animated elements).

Key features include GitHub API integration that fetches repositories, user profile, and activity with database caching for fast loading. The AI Newspaper mode uses Google Gemini to generate hilarious tabloid-style headlines and articles with an archive system. A secret admin system accessible via the terminal enables inline project controls, drag-and-drop reordering, visibility toggles, and content regeneration. Security features include HMAC-signed session tokens, PBKDF2 password hashing, rate limiting, and CSRF protection.
features: 5 Viewing Modes (Default, Terminal, Paper, Newspaper, Nexus)
GitHub API Integration with Database Caching
Secret Admin Mode with Inline Controls

# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/tremors.git
cd tremors/app

# Setup Environment
npm install
cp .env.example .env.local
# Edit .env.local with your values

# Initialize Database
npx prisma generate
npx prisma db push

# Run Development Server
npm run dev

title: The Scrapyard
description: A cyberpunk-themed digital archive for abandoned project ideas, featuring CSS 3D parallax scrolling, a terminal-style search interface, live project previews on hover, and automated GitHub Actions deployment.
longDescription:
A unique conceptual website that serves as a 'Digital Graveyard' a final resting place for abandoned code and half-baked project ideas. It uses CSS 3D transforms to create a vanishing-point parallax scrolling effect where project cards float like scattered papers in space.

The site features cyberpunk aesthetics with dark themes, neon accents, and glitch effects, a terminal-style search bar for instant filtering, and live iframe previews that appear when hovering over any card. It's fully automated via GitHub Actions: a Node.js build script scans the projects/ folder and auto-generates the HTML cards during deployment, so adding a new project is as simple as creating a folder and pushing to main.
installation:
# Install dependencies
npm install

# Build project cards
node build.js
